pkgmetadata.longdescription: Sesman provides facilities for session management and interactive session association with the current contexts (e.g. project, directory, buffers). While sesman can be used to manage arbitrary "sessions", it primary targets the Emacs based IDEs (CIDER, ESS, Geiser, Robe, SLIME etc.) For Emacs based IDEs, session are commonly composed of one or more physical processes (sub-processes, sockets, websockets etc). For example in the current implementation of CIDER a session would be composed of one or more sesman connections (Clojure or ClojureScript). Each CIDER connection consists of user REPL buffer and two sub-processes, one for user eval communication and another for tooling (completion, inspector etc).
